programme.title: Wildest Africa: Cape Coast: Where Worlds Colide

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Nile: An African Odyssey
programme.desc: The Nile is the longest river in the world. Ancient Egypt, one of the history's most powerful civilizations, depended hugely upon it. Each year, it flooded, replenishing the fields with fertile silt. This automatic irrigation fueled Egypt's economy.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Amazon River Islands: The Floating Forest

programme.title: Wildest Latin America: Patagonia: The Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: Patagonia is a place of extremes  of vast ice fields and snow-capped mountains; of windswept deserts, and violent oceans. Survival here means being tough enough to cope with brutal winters, and canny enough to exploit brief seasons of plenty.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Madagascar: Islands of Monsters
programme.desc: Madagascar is truly a weird and wonderful land. Isolated on an island of extreme and magical looking locations, life has adapted and diversified. With few predators, numbers have proliferated and natural selection has gone mad.

programme.desc: Arson fires are set for their own sake, or to cover a different crime, such as murder. Think fire consumes all vital clues? Think again. Arson investigators can glean important clues from scorched rubble and ignite the unquenchable flames of justice.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Face Of Tragedy
programme.desc: Forensic Sculpting: Forensic sculptors retrieve people from oblivion. Using clay and an intricate knowledge of anatomy, forensic arts place a face on an unidentified skull, recreating the victim's likeness, which often leads to his name.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Burning Evidence
programme.desc: Identifying Burned Remains: It's difficult to have a murder investigation without a body, and burning up the victim is a time-honored method of destroying physical evidence.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs are challenged to create a dish with as much consideraton for presentation as taste, with the winner receiving a makeover and photoshoot.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The contestants go to a supermarket with the challenge to spend no more than 10 dollars in 10 minutes for their ingredients.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The four chefs must teach bachelors with no cooking experience how to prepare monkfish, the winner and a chosen guest get to ride on a Goodyear blimp.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Ramsay tests the chefs' ability to identify flavours and ingredients by asking them to re-create one of his specialties, but a contestant becomes overwhelmed.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Full Custom Garage

programme.title: Andromeda: The Honey Offering

programme.title: Andromeda: Star-Crossed

programme.title: Andromeda: It Makes a Lovely Light
programme.desc: Beka takes the Andromeda to Tarn-Vedra, but extended time in the slipstream causes side effects. To combat them, Beka starts taking Flash and soon becomes addicted.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: Dylan and Rommie must rescue Tyr, Harper and Rev from a Magog Worldship.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: Dylan, Beka, Rev and Tyr crash land after escaping a gang of Nietzscheans, but soon face a new threat: Rev's need to feed.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Last Orders
programme.desc: In 1993, devoted father Kevin O'Loughlin came face to face with the dark side of sunny Nelson when he was brutally stabbed to death after a night out on the town.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Into Thin Air
programme.desc: Jim Donnelly was a hard-working family man living a quiet life in suburban Auckland. For 20 years he’d worked as a scientist at the Glenbrook Steel Mill, south of Auckland. On the 21st of June 2004, he simply vanished into thin air.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Girl in The Ditch
programme.desc: When 12 year old Agnes Ali'iva'a drowned in a ditch in 1992, the police initially thought her death was accidental. It was four years before public and political pressure forced police to re-investigate her death.

programme.title: Sensing Murder
programme.desc: Our new team of “ Sensing Murder” psychics are challenged to unmask the killer – or killers – of vivacious New Zealand hairdresser Paula Brown who was plucked from Sydney’s downtown after a night out with friends.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Walk of Innocence
programme.desc: In 1970, eighteen-year-old Olive Waiker disappeared as she walked across Rotorua to babysit her nieces and nephews. Her semi-naked body was found hours later in a rest area south of the city..

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Evil Heart: The Murder of Donna Wheeler
programme.desc: The bloodied, semi-naked body of 30-year-old Donna Wheeler is discovered by her estranged husband Keith Bond and 12-year-old son.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Anita Cobby Murder
programme.desc: In February 1986, nurse Anita Cobby, a former entrant in the Miss Australia quest, is walking home from Blacktown station in Sydney's outer-western suburbs. A Holden sedan pulls up and Anita is dragged into the vehicle.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Michael Kanaan: Shoot to Kill
programme.desc: Michael Kanaan was an angry young man in a hurry to make a name for himself in Sydney’s underworld. But his volatile temper and penchant for violence soon led him to kill three men before he was finally captured in a wild shootout with Sydney police.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Girls Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: Sallie-Anne Huckstepp and Juanita Nielsen were iconic figures in the shadowy King’s Cross scene of the 1970s and 1980s. They lived dangerous lives – challenging the status quo of the period and met with mysterious and violent deaths.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Contract to Kill / The Mornington Monster

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Menehune Mischief
programme.desc: When Beth returns to the compound on the Big Island she finds a damaged SUV and two possible culprits - Dog or Justin. Pressed by Beth, Dog offers a third option. The perpetrators are Hawaii's mythical mischief makers - the Menehune!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mister Mom
programme.desc: It's been quite a while since Tim Chapman put down his mace can and bulletproof vest to care for his growing family. When his old friend Dog calls asking for help tracking an elusive felon, Tim jumps into action.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bait & Snitch
programme.desc: With the aid of the runner's girlfriend the posse heads out to bring a client with a checked past in. Little does the team suspect that before the end of the day Dog will be helping to mend a family torn apart by violence.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Scared Straight
programme.desc: Dog tracks a fugitive who is on the run from the law for the first time. Reading the file Dog knows the young man's life is at the crossroads. Will he be able to track down this wanna-be-gangsta in time to convince him to make the right choice?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: All My Children
programme.desc: For a guy who started life as a free spirited outlaw-biker Dog has certainly turned into a family man. His children touch everything he does today, from searching for the perfect gift for his daughter Cecily's birthday to hunting a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: The hunt for an elusive and clever criminal takes Dog through the world of a bantam fighting cock, a pregnant daughter, and a jungle safe house go together. And don't forget the mopeds as well as a group of hostile squatters on government land!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bounty Baby
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joining the hunt. Can Dog keep his daughter safe and catch his man?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Friday Afternoon Lights
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Master and Duck Commander
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Inlawful Entry
programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends. Meanwhile, Willie helps John Luke start his own snow cone business.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Flock and Key
programme.desc: Si recruits his nephews to help him transport a storage container to his backyard, but things take a turn when Jep becomes locked inside the box. Meanwhile, Jase helps Mia prepare for her cheerleading competition, but the only problem is he has no idea.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Ball in the Family
programme.desc: When Willie's old rival Phillip McMillan challenges him to a game of dodgeball, Willie recruits his family members to settle a score once and for all. Meanwhile, Si thinks his cat is cheating on him with another family, so he recruits Miss Kay.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Drone Survivor
programme.desc: When Jase and Phil make a bet about whether or not human beings in a duck blind are visible from the air, Jep buys a drone copter to get a "bird's eye" view, but ends up losing it in the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Alan in Charge
programme.desc: Jase and the guys convince Willie to hire his older brother Alan to work at Duck Commander, but when Alan begins micromanaging everyone, they quickly change their mind. Meanwhile, the ladies take a self-defense class and use John Luke as a punching bag.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Renaissance Men
programme.desc: When the Robertsons throw a Renaissance Fair birthday party for Godwin, various family members compete in a tournament to win knighthood.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Heroes Welcome
programme.desc: In this special episode, the Duck Commander team surprises two wounded veterans with a trip to Monroe so they can be in an episode of Duck Dynasty. To show their support, the Robertson family stages a color run to bring awareness to our wounded soldiers.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Pie Hard
programme.desc: Willie and Alan agree to help Miss Kay open her own bakery, but things take a turn when Kay is asked to hand over her secret recipes. Meanwhile, the guys in the duck call room take an extended lunch break by driving to Mississippi.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Van He'llsing
programme.desc: When Missy and Jase's son Reed purchases an old van to boost his music career, his parents begin to question some of his choices. Meanwhile, Willie helps Jep prepare River for a competitive wrestling league by introducing him to his friend.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Fifty SAR members from Princeton and Penticton SAR search for an elderly woman who disappeared.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Bears converge on an injured tree faller alone in the wilderness as Nelson SAR races to the scene.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Kent Harrison uses high tech sonar to help RCMP search for a missing camper.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: A snowmobiler trapped 30 metres down an icy crevasse says goodbye to his wife and family.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Nelson SAR team up with a local psychic to find a missing person.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Rossland SAR employs high tech and local knowledge to search for missing skiers.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler SAR is on a mountain mission for missing friends who failed to show up for a landmark birthday party.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Several SAR teams are called out after 200 snowmobilers arereported buried on Boulder Mountain near Revelstoke BC.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler SAR extracts a severely injured stunt snowmobiler. And later, teams search for two people swept down a raging river.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler Search and Rescue helicopter long-lines an injured snowmobiler off a steep mountainside.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Brexit
programme.desc: Over 17 years of marriage Leon has had countless affairs with other women and Siobhan has had it. She claims all he wants is for her to keep his house clean and pick up after him. Leon argues that the problems stem from Siobhan’s bad drinking habits.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Done Done
programme.desc: Nichele says Stewart would pay the neighbors to spy on her. She says he was never supportive when it came to parenting. Stewart says Nichele has always denied cheating on him but he believes in his heart she did.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Fantasy Fail
programme.desc: Victoria is sick of Casey neglecting his responsibilities. Casey feels like a slave for taking care of the kids while she flies around the world for modeling gigs. Can Casey break out of the Mr. Mom role and start helping with the bills?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Uninvited Guest Part 1
programme.desc: Jacoby Garrett is fighting to save his marriage of 15 years. Meanwhile his wife, Kim Garrett has her belongings packed and is waiting on the moving truck.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Uninvited Guest Part 2
programme.desc: Jacoby says his wife has stolen money to feed her gambling addiction. Kim says that his mother is a huge thorn in her side. In 15 years, Kim says she is still scratching her head as to why Jacoby’s mother bad mouths her to everyone.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Blame It on the Sun
programme.desc: When Milton came into Sona’s life, all the stars were aligned but now their relationship has been out of orbit. Sona is a firm believer in astrology and zodiac signs, but this Leo can no longer tolerate the cheating ways of Milton who is an Aries.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Secret Lies
programme.desc: Billy wants Marylu to quit pole dancing and stripping, while she wants Billy to confess if he’s straight or not. Billy has a fetish for wearing women’s underwear and he needs to fess up if he likes women, men or both.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Player of the Year
programme.desc: Jordan says that Taurean is the biggest player with the ladies and still decides to lie about it even after she gave him a chance to have an open relationship. He says he talks to other women because Jordan is unaffectionate and verbally abusive.

programme.title: Divorce Court: My Money
programme.desc: Barbara says Alicia is a cheater and a thief. Barbara's seen Alicia’s text messages from men and asserts she is verbally abusive and financially irresponsible. Alicia says Barbara is controlling, a liar, selfish and never committed to their marriage.

programme.title: Divorce Court: I Scream U Scream
programme.desc: Sharee moved in with Brandon shortly after they met, had a child and still no marriage. Brandon wants her to get a full-time job and not work part-time in their business before they get married.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Coming to America
programme.desc: Keith claims he is married to two other women overseas and plans to bring them over! Paw'lla says Keith is a fake pastor who doesn't know what he's talking about! Keith says he has a master plan for all of these wives!

programme.title: Divorce Court: Studs Need Love Too
programme.desc: Tahani said Cymbre's jealous fits of rage has caused her to lose a job and suspects him of cheating after finding a hotel receipt! He doesn't trust her either after she cheated before. Will this couple be able to trust again or are they too far gone?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: And Baby Makes Three
programme.desc: Leland has to attend a Lamaze class before he can join the hunt--another Chapman is on the way! But when Dog starts to go after this accused jewelry thief without his fastest son, he learns that this fugitive puts the "R" in runner.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Fight Like A Girl
programme.desc: This one is close to home. Dog's target on today's hunt is the cousin of Kali, Garry Boy's caregiver. In addition, she has a reputation as a brawler. With Duane Lee still missing from the team Baby Lyssa decides she will step-up in this hunt.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: The hunt for an elusive and clever criminal takes Dog through the world of a bantam fighting cock, a pregnant daughter, and a jungle safe house go together. And don't forget the mopeds as well as a group of hostile squatters on government land!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Kid Stuff
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice is on the lam and it's Dog's job to find him. When they hit the last known address they discover he already has pulled up stakes and left no forwarding address. The posse's one hope is to locate his girlfriend.

programme.title: Operation Repo starts 9pm
programme.desc: STARTS 9PM Take a ride along with Operation Repo! This docudrama series takes an in-depth look at the professional, but sometimes murky world of car repossession. Get ready for the drama!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Cupid in Cuffs
programme.desc: It's the day before Valentine's Day and love is in the air at Da Kine Bail Bonds--but not for Tapi who has failed to appear in court on theft charges. Dog's plan is to have Leland knock on Tapi's door with a Valentine's gift to draw her out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: No Ice in Paradise
programme.desc: Dog and his team fight the war on ice-crystal methamphetamine-on many fronts. They appear on a special anti-drug float in a parade. Then they go after bail-jumping Pana, a convicted drug dealer.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Easy Rider
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down a fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close knit community.

programme.title: Run's House: Baby Fever
programme.desc: Looking at baby photos sparks Justine's desire to have another baby. Rev Run tries to convince Justine otherwise, but she is certain about what she wants.

programme.title: Run's House: A Healthy Heart
programme.desc: Run finds a dead fish in the family's tank and gives it a proper send-off with a prayer: "Ashes to ashes and flush to flush."

programme.title: Run's House: All Work & No Peace
programme.desc: Run heads to New York's Z100 radio station to speak with DJ Cubbie and promote his new album 'Distortion.' But Run is starting to feel the pressure of working and running a company.

programme.title: Run's House: Maximum Growth
programme.desc: Vanessa is approached to pose in Maxim Magazine, but is concerned about her father's reaction. Meanwhile, Jojo tries to pass his "behind-thewheel" test for his Driver's Permit. And the Rev gets a "sign" to buy a new Lamborghini.

programme.title: Run's House: Vegas Vacation
programme.desc: Rev has a shoe convention to attend in Las Vegas and takes the family with him. Rev enlists help from Vanessa and Angela to plan a surprise for Justine.

programme.title: Run's House: Rev's Fix It List
programme.desc: Some of Rev's husbandly habits are wearing thin on Justine and leaving her feeling disrespected. Rev is shocked to hear that there are a "few" things to improve and challenges Justine to make a list.

programme.title: Run's House: Rev Mom
programme.desc: Rev and Justine discover that Justine is pregnant. As the family deals with the news Justine realizes that she has plenty she wants to accomplish before she feels immobilized by her pregnancy.

programme.title: Run's House: Downward Facing Dawg
programme.desc: Seeking relief from the stress of his life, Run seeks the advice of his brother, Russell. Run decides to shadow his brother and give yoga a try in hopes that peace will find him.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Who's Your Daddy?
programme.desc: Lynn’s birth father visits L.A.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Porn to Write
programme.desc: Maya sees the seedy side of publishing.

programme.title: Girlfriends: All the Creatures Were Stirring
programme.desc: Joan and William are stranded by a blizzard.

programme.title: Paranormal State: School House Haunting
programme.desc: PRS travels to Massachusetts to investigate an old schoolhouse where children's voices disturb a couple who've made it their home.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Bedroom Eyes
programme.desc: PRS travels to rural Pennsylvania to investigate a haunting that began after a new couple moved into an old family farm.?Over the next three days, hidden tragedies are uncovered and latent psychic abilities are revealed.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Lady Vampire

programme.desc: Krystina's only hope for life seems dashed, as the mother of the heart donor retracts her offer to allow the operation; Neil McVane carries out his promise of blackmail.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Garage
programme.desc: Krystina is welcomed home, following her so-far successful heart transplant; Alexis' affections are pursued by a wealthy real estate baron; convinced he is not a Carrington, Adam's life begins to crumble.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Shower
programme.desc: Adam continues to slip further away from Dana and his family, as doubts to his Carrington heritage have their effect; Alexis ends her relationship with Michael Culhane.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.55
programme.desc: Teen throws house party while dad's away; alleged damages to neighbor's car ensue. Young ex-lovers dispute alleged loan for body-piercing school. Woman sues body-piercing student ex-roommate for unpaid rent.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.226
programme.desc: A father intervenes, hiring attorneys to aid his son in jail release and custody battles after domestic violence charges. The son denies owing anything. A teenager sues ex-roommates for lease breakage.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.92

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.82

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.125
programme.desc: Family disputes details and payment for deceased woman's $19,000 funeral after 15-year cancer battle/Ex-boyfriend sued for unpaid credit card charges in her name; cites father's death and hardships.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.258
programme.desc: A custody battle, eBay sales dispute, and check fraud alleged in woman's lawsuit against child's father for storage fees. Man claims son illegally repossessed his motorcycle; son countersues for bike damages.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.215
programme.desc: A teenager sues her ex-boyfriend for the return of cell phone and for punitive damages from an assault. A man is suing his former friend for lighting his couch on fire; he countersues for storage fees.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Ben Stiller

programme.desc: Bear and Joseph Gordon-Levitt navigate Kenya's unyielding terrain; Joseph and Bear navigate a perilous rappel, milk a camel for hydration, ascend a massive rock dome and battle a crocodile for dinner; Joseph talks about his family and rise to fame.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Shaquille O'Neal

programme.title: World's Greatest: Extreme Animals
programme.desc: Extreme Animals features environments hostile to humans, but havens to many animals. Witness gorgeous glow-worms, high flying condors, parched thorny devils, emperor penguins, and polar bears in this journey through life on the edge.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Remote Cities
programme.desc: Brave the frontiers of the world’s most remote cities. More than distant trading posts and isolated regional hubs, cities like Alice Springs, Jaipur and even Las Vegas serve as gateways to the wild places of the Earth.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Sacred Sites
programme.desc: Ancient in architecture and detailed in design, these man-made masterpieces stand as testaments to the strength of human faith. These sites endure as a timeless reminder of resilience, respect, and the need to reflect.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Water Adventures
programme.desc: We are captivated by oceans, rivers, and lakes - the power, the flow, the reflective stillness. And as we seek to get closer, we immerse ourselves in an expanding range of aquatic experiences.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Glaciers
programme.desc: Clinging to the world’s highest mountains and forming ice caps on both poles, glaciers leave an impression on the landscape and on all who bear witness to their splendor.

programme.title: Arthur: Ants in Arthur's Pants/Don't Ask Muffy
programme.desc: To excel in science, the class has to prove that they have P.A.N.T.S.--the ability to be patient, attentive, nosy, thoughtful, and systematic. And Muffy starts an advice column to launch her career as a rich and famous talk-show host.

programme.title: Arthur: Prunella Sees the Light/Return of the Snowball
programme.desc: For her sleepover with Marina, Prunella redecorates her room. But Marina is blind--will the decorations she can't see offend her, or worse, make her trip? D.W. has been trying to solve the mystery of her snowball's disappearance.

programme.title: Arthur: What's Cooking?/Buster's Special Delivery
programme.desc: Celebrity chef Ming Tsai is judging Lakewood Elementary's first-ever cooking contest, and Arthur thinks he has a shot at winning. Then, Buster volunteers to deliver the school mail and finds out that his new job is actually hard work!

programme.title: D.W. and the Beastly Birthday
programme.desc: Time to put on your party hats and dancing shoes – D.W. is turning five! When her birthday doesn’t go as planned, D.W. runs away to the magical island of Ukubonga. This is one party you don’t want to miss!

programme.title: Arthur: Muffy's Classy Classics Club/Best Enemies
programme.desc: Muffy buys all of the books and dolls in the Pretty Pioneers series and invites her friends to join a pretty book club. Mom has new clients coming over and they have a daughter who is D.W.'s age. They're going to be the best of friends!

programme.title: Arthur: Just Desserts/The Big Dig
programme.desc: Arthur has a hard time resisting sweets, and one evening his overindulgence wins him an upset stomach and some 'Grimm' dreams. Arthur and D.W. loved it when Grandpa Dave came to visit--but now he only wants to sleep and play checkers.

programme.title: Arthur: Vomitrocious!/Sue Ellen Chickens Out
programme.desc: It's just a regular day until Francine starts to feel queasy, and then throws up in the cafeteria! Now Francine is afraid to go back to school. And, Sue Ellen learns that a fast-food chain is taking over the beloved Sugar Bowl.

programme.title: Arthur: The Director's Cut/Crime and Consequences
programme.desc: After meeting his hero, Hollywood director Tufton Sinclair, George is inspired to make a movie of his own. When George accidentally breaks the class's prize woodworking project, Binky gets unfairly blamed.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters: Paul Touvier
programme.desc: Nazi Hunters examines how French investigators hunted down Paul Touvier a pro-Nazi sympathizer who was responsible for murdering both Jews and resistance fighters.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters: Kurt Lischka
programme.desc: Nazi Hunters looks at how German housewife Beate Klarsfeld and her husband Serge helped track down former Paris Gestapo chief Kurt Lishka. Lishka ordered the arrest and murder of over 33,000 Jews.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters: Joseph Mengele
programme.desc: Nazi Hunters examines how Mossad agents from Israel spent nearly thirty years tracking the notorious Nazi physician Josef Mengele. After the war, Mengele flees to Argentina where he lives a relatively nondescript life.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters: Erich Priebke
programme.desc: Nazi Hunters examines how, a half-century after the war, American journalists track down former Gestapo officer Erich Priebke. Priebke who was responsible for some of Italy's worst atrocities fled to Argentina after the war.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters: Klaus Barbie
programme.desc: Nazi Hunters looks at how the husband and wife team of Serge and Beate Klarsfeld worked tirelessly to have Nazi war criminal Klaus Barbie extradited from Bolvia to stand trail in France.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters: Adolf Eichmann
programme.desc: Nazi Hunters examines the capture of Adolf Eichmann considered by many to be one of the main architects of the Holocaust. Eichmann was captured outside of his home near Buenos Aires in Argentina by Mossad agents.

programme.title: Catfish UK: Tasheeka & Aaron
programme.desc: After avoiding video calls for 2 years, Tasheeka is desperate to find out if Aaron is her Prince Charming. It's up to Julie and Oobah to see if this online romance has a fairy tale ending. (S1, ep3)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Mario & Hannah
programme.desc: After turning his life around, Mario met his soulmate, Hannah. But she refuses to speak on the phone and won't meet in person. Julie and Oobah try to find out who his dream girl really is. (S1, ep7)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Jaylin is prepared to sacrifice a lifelong friendship and promising videogame career to be with a woman he's never even spoken to on the phone. (S5, ep5)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: After being paralysed as a teenager, Robert met Ashleigh online and they fell in love. With news he may not have much longer to live, Robert asks Nev and Max to bring Ashleigh to him. (S6, ep16)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Kailani has fallen for Sam, her gay friend's online ex-boyfriend. Sam claims to love Kailani, but has been acting strange since she has tried to meet up with him. Nev and Max investigate. (S6, ep9)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Mama doesn't always know best. Shuntay enlists the help of Nev and Max after her mum begins talking about marriage and uprooting her family to be with a man who refuses to meet in person. (S5, ep2)

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 110
programme.desc: After going to the last two proms with Taylor as friends, Polly is ready to upgrade her relationship. Stephanie wants to retire her party girl image and ask Josh to be her boyfriend.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 111
programme.desc: Stephanie is tired of only fantasizing about Mike's "sexy face" and she's ready to make him her boyfriend. Sean and Kate were friends at first sight, now Sean wants to up the stakes.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 112
programme.desc: David tells his best friend Maia that he's been in love with her for 9 years. B-Hawk tries to prove to his friend Toni that there's more to him than meets the eye.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 113
programme.desc: Kris tries to woo his best friend Lauren with a special love song. Rachel musters the courage to tell Billy how she really feels.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 114
programme.desc: Bryan and Megan have been best friends for 10 years and he can no longer keep his feeling contained. Kenise thinks that she and James can be more than workout buddies.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 115
programme.desc: Arty Krystal confesses her love to unsuspecting friend Nishell. Mike tells gal pal Rachel that he's in love with her.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 116
programme.desc: Alex tells his best friend's sister that he has strong feelings for her. Asha tells her friend Chris that she wants more than friendship.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 117
programme.desc: Aja confesses her feelings to best friend Charles. Paulie tries to convince his friend Bethany that there is more between them that just friendship!

programme.title: The Hills: Enough Is Enough / New Year, New Friends
programme.desc: Spencer asks Heidi to move in with him but Heidi doesn't know what to do or how to tell her roommate, Lauren. (S2, ep8)

programme.title: The Hills: Apology Not Accepted / Everyone Falls
programme.desc: Lauren's turning 21 and Heidi has big plans for the birthday bash. But, before the party, Heidi decides it's time to tell Lauren about Spencer's big idea to move in together. (S2, ep10)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Who Killed the Prosecutor?
programme.desc: Steve Tauzer, a prominent assistant district attorney in Kern County, CA, was found murdered in his garage. Chris Hillis, a former police officer, a colleague and friend of Tauzer, was arrested for the murder. Chris’ son Lance was key to the case.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Natalee Holloway: New Clues In Paradise
programme.desc: A report on new details into the search for Natalee Holloway, a U.S. teenager who disappeared on May 30, 2005 during a post-graduation trip in the Caribbean island of Aruba.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Bad Bet
programme.desc: A bookie comes under suspicion when his wife is killed.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Ghosts of El Segundo
programme.desc: In July 1957 Richard Phillips and Milton Curtis, two California police officers on a routine stop, were gunned down by a man who had just committed robbery and rape nearby. Investigators searched for over 45 years for the man who murdered two of their own

programme.title: 48 Hours: Chasing the Barefoot Bandit
programme.desc: A report on Colton Harris-Moore, also known as the “Barefoot Bandit,” because of his habit of committing crimes barefoot and leaving chalk outlines of his feet; and whose exploits included stealing planes, guns, yachts, and escaping to foreign countries.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Strange Truth
programme.desc: In March 2003, Ramona Krotine left an office party and was never seen alive again. 24 hours later, she was found in the trunk of her car, beaten and shot to death. At first, police suspected a botched robbery but later believed her husband was to blame.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield's Moving Experience/U.S. Acres: Wade: You're Afraid/Good Mousekeeping
programme.desc: Garfield decides to move away from home./Orson hypnotizes Wade./Garfield must rid the house of mice.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Binky Goes Bad/Barn of Fear/Screaming with Binky

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield goes to the Lamaar School of Cats. Roy Rooster learns the art of doublespeak.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Jon gets to meet Vivacia, the TV horror show hostess of his dreams. Wade Duck is caught in a 60-minute style interview.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: After falling asleep while playing a board game, Jon dreams he and Garfield are in it.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield demonstrates the importance of sound effects. The Wolf convinces the crew aliens have landed.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield’s neighbor moves out and rent their house to a singer.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Seeing Tonbo's skill, Coach Hajime sets his sights on the Kyushu Women's Championship. But first, she must qualify. Balancing high school, practice range, and course time, Tonbo trains hard to secure her spot in the tournament.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: On day one of the Kyushu Women’s Championship, Tonbo is paired with Shima-san, a housewife golfer who barely qualifies. Though some competitors are irritated, Shima-san’s unique style soon inspires those around her.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Tonbo leads her first tournament with a bold, freewheeling golf style! On day two, she's paired with top players Hinoki, Tsubura, and Ema, who's fighting for a comeback after a rough past. The competition heats up from the first hole!

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: On day two of the tournament, Tonbo, Hinoki, Tsubura, and Ema are paired up. Hinoki feels pressured by her father, Tsubura plays her usual style, and Ema makes a comeback. Tonbo stays carefree, while Hinoki surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Igarashi arrives in Kumamoto the night before the final day, offering Tonbo advice. On the last day, with trainee caddie Nishida, Tonbo uses the wind to her advantage, climbing the leaderboard and becoming a serious rival to Hinoki, Tsubura, and Ema.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: On the final day, Tonbo plays freely while Hinoki, Tsubura, and Ema close in. Hinoki leads at halftime but seems down. In the second half, Hinoki's shot hits a tree branch, causing an unexpected setback for her.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: On the final day, Hinoki uses a penalty to reset mentally, Tsubura plays strategically, and Emma risks a shot despite her injury. Meanwhile, Tonbo feels the weight of competition, leading to a shift in her resolve.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: With three holes left, Tonbo charges, closing in on the leader. Tsubura and Emma struggle, while Hinoki regains composure. All four are tied, setting up a dramatic finish. On the final hole, Tonbo's tee shot takes an unexpected turn, changing everything.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: Emma powers through her injury, Hinoki battles her limits, and Tsubura stays true to her style. Tonbo cheers them on from the sidelines. The intense showdown over the final stroke builds to a thrilling, unexpected finish.

programme.title: Tonbo!
programme.desc: After the Kyushu Women’s Championship, Tonbo and Igarashi travel to Hinoshima to report the results. They reflect on new challenges in Kumamoto and recall the people who supported Tonbo and her rivals, as her golf journey continues to soar with promise.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Reasonable Doubt
